Package itunesq

Class Utilities

java.lang.Object
itunesq.Utilities
public final class Utilities extends Object
Class that contains various useful utility methods.

This is a final class consisting entirely of static methods.

Author:
Jon

      Parameters:
      timeString - time string to be parsed
      Returns:
      time in milliseconds
      Throws:
      ParseException - If an error occurs trying to parse the time string.

    • typingAssistant

      public static boolean typingAssistant​(org.apache.pivot.wtk.TextInput textInput, org.apache.pivot.collections.ArrayList<String> names, String text, Filter.Operator operator)
      Provides typing assistance for text input fields, when the list of possible choices is reasonably small, for example artist or playlist names.

      This is expected to be called for every character entered into a text field. As soon as enough characters are entered to uniquely identify a name, the text field is populated with the name. A case-insensitive comparator should be used on the list of names, so the user doesn't need to use correct case, but that's up to the caller.

      Parameters:
      textInput - text input object in which the user is typing
      names - list of names to check against
      text - text entered so far by the user
      operator - filter operator (we only support IS and CONTAINS operators)
      Returns:
      true if a match was found, otherwise false

    • updateFromXMLFile

      public static void updateFromXMLFile​(String xmlFileName, org.apache.pivot.wtk.Window owningWindow) throws IOException
      Processes the XML file, and updates the main window XML file information.
      Parameters:
      xmlFileName - name of the XML file to be processed
      owningWindow - owning window
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs trying to read the XML file.

    • updateMainWindowLabels

      public static void updateMainWindowLabels​(String xmlFileName)
      Updates the XML file information on the main window.

      This is somewhat tricky. MainWindow calls several methods in this class to save the actual Label variables, for example saveFileLabel. It then calls this method to fill in the label values. Likewise, if the XML file is changed while running, updateFromXMLFile also calls this method. All this so I don't have to repeat this code in two places.

      Parameters:
      xmlFileName - XML file name

    • accessJavaPreference

      public static String accessJavaPreference​(String key)
      Accesses the Java preference for a given key. This method also sets the preference in case it was not currently set.
      Parameters:
      key - key that represents the preference
      Returns:
      value for the specified key

    • saveJavaPreference

      public static void saveJavaPreference​(String key, String value)
      Saves the Java preference for a given key.
      Parameters:
      key - key that represents the preference
      value - value for the specified key
